questionsAndAnswers.q: What are the objects of a set called?
_ is defined as the number of elements in a set
If every element in set A is in set B, then A is a _ of B
If A is a subset of B, but there exists an element in A not in B, then A is a _ of B
The _ of A and B is the set of elements in A or B
The _ of A and B is the set of elements in both A and B
The _ between A is B is the set of elements in A but not B
The difference between two sets is not _
